column5: Hi all...  just stopping in to say hello...  Lots of ice on the lake still... skif of new snow this morning... and a biting wind... but the sun's out...  And there are signs of spring... geese are back, 2 bald eagles, 1 sea-gull, 1 lonely robin... and lots of LBJs (little brown jobbies).  Ice fishing season is over and the walleyes are taking a well deserved break from all the pressure...  Lots of wind this winter... I've got a ton of branches (and trees) to clean up... going to be lots of bon-fires... soon.  Cheers.......!   the capt.
Good to hear from you Kevin. Save some of that kindling for June :-)
Hello Kevin, good to see you've come out of another hibernation safely.
Nice to hear an update from Lakair Kevin.  Only a couple months and we'll be invading your little piece of heaven  Joey
I'll see you on June 22nd Kev, you know where to pile that firewood

Good to hear from you Kevin, won't be long for the ice to break up....I hope...take good care of those Walleye my friend, I hope to be up at least once this summer....oh and don't forget the Pike  Maureen

Good to hear from you all....  Yeap... the old bear.. finally comes out, scratching his butt... to take a peak at the sunshine..!  Of course... ,with every cut of the saw, I'm thinking how much these OFC boys are goin' to enjoy cooking this nice white pine....!  But don't thank me.. thank Mother Nature for wiping up 100km/hr winds... to knock the heck out of my forest... "and it all came down..."  Lots of singles off the roofs too...  NO flying fish ...however... thank God.. for the ice to keep them all contained...!
That reminds me, I must call Zack to ask him what the ice conditions are on the West Arm.
